    • Constructor Detail

      • LargeArrayVL

        public LargeArrayVL(java.lang.String rootDir,
            java.lang.String filePrefix,
            int numOfCaches)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from a a LargeArray. A LargeArray is a nearly infinite large persistent array that, once written, can only be read. From the array, only a certain number of files is read into the memory, thus even large arrays can be managed at runtime. This type of LargeArray has a variable record length ("VL"). These arrays have inpredictable memory requirement, as the number of records per file is constant and NOT the file size.
        Parameters:
        rootDir - directory that is used to store the LargeArray
        filePrefix - the file names prefix used to store the data
        numOfCaches - how many files should be loaded into memory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
